current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic significantly drove down petroleum refining revenue in 2020 as many businesses were forced to close operations and stay-at-home orders were enforced. Less fuel was demanded for production and transportation.

Along with the COVID-19 pandemic, the war in Ukraine has also caused increases in the price of crude oil, as the US has banned imports of Russian petroleum since the initial invasion in March of 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies, collectively known as OPEC+, have pledged production cuts since late 2022, aiming to drive up the world price of crude oil.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: PROFIT REMAINS VOLATILE AS DEMAND HAS FLUCTUATED AND THE IMPORTANCE OF TRADE HAS HEIGHTENED
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The slowdown in economic growth following the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic resulted in sluggish growth in demand, making it difficult for refineries to pass on crude oil costs to downstream customers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Imports have historically dominated international trade in the Petroleum Refining industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The United States has been a net exporter of refined petroleum products as low WTI prices in some recent years have reduced input costs for domestic refineries.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Petroleum Refining Industry Remains Concentrated
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: With the construction of new petroleum refineries facing formidable barriers, including environmental and permitting restrictions, along with general political opposition, the petroleum refining industry has maintained a relatively high level of concentration.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE US WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE GLOBAL LEADER IN OIL PRODUCTION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the coming years, the US is set to continue to be a global leader in oil production.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: US REFINED PETROLEUM EXPORTS WILL GAIN GROUND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the coming years, industry exports are set to see continued growth, accounting for a growing share of overall industry revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Green Energy Transition is a Long Term Threat
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In the coming years, the petroleum refining industry will begin to see the impacts of the transition to green energy.
A weaker US dollar increases US exports as they become more affordable relative to foreign counterparts.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STRINGENT REGULATIONS AND STANDARDS RAISE COSTS AND THREATEN DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Stringent regulations enacted by states including California and New York will likely hinder industry revenue growth.

industry_definition: Industry operators refine crude oil into petroleum products. Petroleum refining involves one or more activities including fractionation, straight distillation of crude oil and cracking. This industry does not include companies that extract crude oil or retail gasoline.
key_trends: Increases in the world price of crude oil have driven industry revenue growth as petroleum refiners have passed along input costs.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Downstream markets import refined petroleum products when demand is high and domestic output cannot keep up.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of crude oil is a key input into the manufacturing process and its price is traditionally very volatile.

FAQs.question: Has your company located near key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: Refineries can reduce transportation costs and improve profitability by locating near downstream markets.
